cz.zcu.kiv.bp.probe

Class Probe

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.zcu.kiv.bp.probe.Probe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProbe, org.springframework.osgi.context.BundleContextAware

    public class Probe
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.osgi.context.BundleContextAware, IProbe
    Provides convenient methods for picking stuff off the OSGi environment.
    Author:
    Michal

      • findBundle

        public org.osgi.framework.Bundle findBundle(java.lang.String description)
                                     throws NoSuchBundleException
        Description copied from interface: IProbe
        Tries to found bundle described by string in format symbolic.name:Major.Minor.Micro. Stops with the first bundle that has matching description!
        Specified by:
        findBundle in interface IProbe
        Parameters:
        description - symbolic.name:Major.Minor.Micro fromated bundle description
        Returns:
        found Bundle instance or null when not found
        Throws:
        NoSuchBundleException

      • findClassesInBundle

        public java.lang.Class<?>[] findClassesInBundle(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle,
                                       java.lang.String[] classesToFind)
                                         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: IProbe
        Tries to load described classes from the given bundle.
        Specified by:
        findClassesInBundle in interface IProbe
        Parameters:
        bundle - which should be probed
        classesToFind - array of class names to find
        Returns:
        array of loaded classes
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when bundle's classloader fails to load class

      • getServiceInstances

        public java.lang.Object[] getServiceInstances(java.lang.String serviceName,
                                     java.lang.String filter,
                                     int waitLimit)
        Description copied from interface: IProbe
        Tries to acquire all service instances from OSGi context using given filter.
        Specified by:
        getServiceInstances in interface IProbe
        Parameters:
        serviceName - name of the service to acquire
        filter - LDAP filter - Do not use (objectclass=...), it is already used from serviceName parameter!
        waitLimit - time in [ms] to wait for service to be activated
        Returns:
        array of instances

                                                   java.lang.String filter,
                                                   boolean tractAllServices)
        Description copied from interface: IProbe
        Returns ServiceTracker for given service. If the tracker does not exist, it creates and stores new one.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
